COVID-19 response tracker Visionary Futures Collective

The project

This group seeks to explore alternate futures for academic institutions at a time of precarity and transformation. The present project addresses the impact of the COVID-19 outbreak on labor and safety. We are currently gathering data on nation-wide return to campus plans for fall 2020.

Want to join us?
We meet weekly on Tuesdays from 4-6et to build community and work together on digital projects.
Sign up to join us by Zoom.

Questions? Tweet at us with #C19VFC.

#COVIDCampus data collection

The VFC is building a corpus of news reports to track how universities are responding and how policies are changing. See our documentation for adding to the corpus.

We are asking university workers and students to contribute information about campus reopening policies that are hidden from view, focusing on violent and violating policies. Add your institution to our database, moderated by Dawn Kaczmar.

#COVIDCampus FeelingsMap

The FeelingsMap will iteratively collect emotion-based responses to campus and national news to visually represent our collective moment. Our intention is to provide an ever-developing map of feelings across cities, regions, and campuses, and in return for submissions, provide ways individuals can engage with VFC project development.

#COVIDCampus visualizations

The VFC will be designing and publishing data visualizations with the goal of making visible the shifting discourse around campus closings and reopenings, and the ways that life, labor, and economics are manipulated in the name of access to higher education.

Our intention is to visualize data that can have an impact on how we approach and manage the Fall 2020 semester.

Data based on the Chronicle of Higher Education's tracking over 1000 colleges’ plans for reopening in the fall (July 21 data).

Data based on this community-sourced spreadsheet. Add your institution here!

Related projects

The Coronavirus Corpus is designed to be the definitive record of the social, cultural, and economic impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in 2020 and beyond.

The Chronicle of Higher Education is currently tracking over 1000 colleges’ plans for reopening in the fall.

The Chronicle is also exploring the data in terms of type of university.

The Chronicle has visualizations of its data on reopening.

A data visualization of the “Top 100” Universities’ Fall Plans.

Inside Higher Ed is tracking the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Karen Kelsky of "The Professor is In" is also tracking hiring freezes since March.

Bearing Witness is an effort to document and interpret the events associated with the novel coronavirus epidemic in the United States as it pertains to racialized minorities.

Various websites are mapping the spread of COVID-19 in the United States.

Covid Tracking collects data on the spread of COVID-19.

Georgia Tech’s “COVID-19 Event Risk Planning Tool”.

For a digital storytelling project exploring the return to campus, check out this choose-your-own-adventure game.

The College Crisis Initiative is an undergraduate intitiative collecting and visualizing data on campus reopenings, focusing on four-year institutions.

Humanist Mutual Aid is an initiative to bring together workers in higher education for mutual support.
